posts.post_content: It is difficult to describe just how broken this card is. One would have to watch a Mirrodin-block deck draw through the entirety of its library in a single turn and then watch as almost every card drawn gets played thanks to affinity and summarily sacrificed to both kill you and draw more cards to truly appreciate it.

posts.post_content: If this card was to be legalized in Legacy, then I could definitely see Merfolk, in particular, abusing the SNOT out of this card. Think about it, first turn, land drop, Aether Vial. Next turn, drop a Cursecatcher with the Vial and drop Skullclamp, and probably some other 1-drop. Then, turn 3 Standstill. Right there, it seems that the course of the entire game is decided. The advantage that could be generated from this would be INSANE! Keep it banned.

posts.post_content:
Anyone that doubts this card is a fool, it is five stars all the way.
